prompt: "Most dogs are friendly" cannot be expressed in standard first-order logic. Why?
options: First-order logic can't express proportional quantifiers
hint: Standard FOL has ∀ (all) and ∃ (some), but what about 'most', 'few', 'many'?
explanation: Proportional quantifiers like 'most' (more than half), 'few', 'many' can't be expressed with just ∀ and ∃. They require counting or comparing set sizes, which standard FOL can't do. Extended logics (generalized quantifiers) can handle them.
visual_concept: ∀ = ALL of them. ∃ = At least ONE. 'Most' = More than half. Standard FOL can only see the first two.
